intro: Erythroxylum wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan copal tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Erythroxylaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of the Himalayas, including parts of India, Nepal, and Bhutan. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by woody, spherical fruits. The bark and leaves of Erythroxylum wallichii contain various bioactive compounds, making it of interest in traditional and modern pharmacology. It plays a role in local ecosystems and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
